1. The Heart Goes Last by @MargaretAtwood. A funny, witty, thought-provoking story about marriage in a social exper… https://t.co/q40H7cUBtC
2. Hot Milk by Deborah Levy. This was such a good book to read in the heatwave last summer. If you've issues with your mother read this!
3. The Glorious Heresies by @SwearyLady. I get attached to characters and the lead Ryan is muddled in my memories a… https://t.co/DeiCOnrCAa
4. Next up the FIERCE Fates and Furies by Lauren Groff. Wow! Another depiction of marriage from both sides. Powerfu… https://t.co/0P4IuMCfA9
5. Olive Kitteridge - I couldn't put this down. It's a quiet character book but think we've all got a little bit of… https://t.co/BnmtghZkMG
6. My Name Is Leon by @KitdeWaal. Made me laugh and cry. An amazing book and if your haven't read it yet then get i… https://t.co/brPll9CRoU
7. Five Rivers Met in a Wooded Plain by Barney Norris. I loved the characters in this story and it's stayed with me. https://t.co/0FKzt7qjqt
